intro: Peristrophe doriae, commonly known as Doria's sedge, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. It is a perennial herb characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils, often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Peristrophe doriae produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting various insect and bird populations.
